result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
from def Re: upcoming prelim hearing

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle except only as necessary to travel to/from employment and/or for job-search activities. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)].

02:56 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Erin Nagy.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.
